article:
'Counter-proliferation' refers to diplomatic, intelligence, and military efforts
to combat the proliferation of weapons, including both weapons of mass
destruction (WMD), long-range missiles, and certain conventional weapons.
Nonproliferation and arms control are related terms. In contrast to
nonproliferation, which focuses on diplomatic, legal and administrative measures
to dissuade and impede the acquisition of such weapons, counter-proliferation
focuses on intelligence, law enforcement, and sometimes military action to
prevent their acquisition.
